OpenTA issues:

openta-2019 must be opened first to authenticate. Thereafter Frameless OpenTA can be opened.

Most remaining issues have to do with CSRF protection and third party cookies. You must allow third-party cookies and disable browser CSRF protection ( Canvas and OpenTA does it's own CSRF protection which collides if Safari also does it. )

Specifically:

  • Firefox: If openta-2019 hangs, make sure you allow third-party cookies in your browser. "Standard" security settings is OK. "Strict" breaks OpenTA through Canvas
  • Safari : Under Preferences -> Privacy make sure you allow cookies and uncheck "Prevent cross-site tracking".

Workaround for mobile phones (recommended)

  • Use the Canvas Student App

Workarounds for computer browsers

  • Use Chrome

Workaround for both mobile and computer: Use OpenTA outside Canvas.

  • If you cannot or do not like to turn off these security features, log in to OpenTA-2019 via Canvas once, if necessary with reduced security.
  • Then use the key icon at the top of the OpenTA page to assign yourself a password, and make a note of your username. This is probably your email, but not necessarily.
  • Using this login and password go to https://ffm234.openta.physics.gu.se/ and use the website independently of Canvas therafter using this login and password.
